Context:
The Decision-Making graduate certificate program at George Brown College's School of Management prepares students for data analysis in multifaceted business decision-making needs. This business analytics program focuses on skills development, both technical and otherwise, including programming, applied statistical comprehension, database understanding, and analytic dissemination for various business uses.

The program is offered in a hybrid modality and is delivered primarily in the evenings and Saturdays, with some weekday sessions. The minimum computing requirements include a PC running Windows 8 or higher with 8MB RAM and an i5 processor, Microsoft Windows® 10 or Server 2016 + 64-bit versions of Windows, a web camera and microphone, and PC Version Microsoft Office including Access. For students preferring Apple/Mac environments, they must also have Bootcamp/Parallels and a copy of Windows 10, as well as the Microsoft Office suite with Access.

The program includes the BUS 4045 Data Project Capstone Project, where students analyze real-world data to make meaningful business recommendations based on client feedback and interaction. This work experience can be added to resumes. The Analytics Hub is also mentioned, but no further information is provided about it in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Analytics for Business Decision Making Program (Postgraduate) B412 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Analytics Hub is a platform that brings together students, faculty, and industry to gain insights from data from both private and public sources. This program prepares graduates for careers in various organizations such as marketing research firms, polling firms, branding/design firms, insurance and finance firms, loyalty programs (marketing), health care, public sector, manufacturing and supply chain. Potential positions include: business analyst, data analyst, market risk analytics officer, web analytics manager, decision support specialist, web analyst, and data-reporting analyst.

To graduate from this program, students need to complete 14 mandatory courses spread over two semesters. In Semester 1, the following courses are required: BUS 4046 – Introduction to Business Analytics (no prerequisite), BUS 4047 – Applied Business Communication (no prerequisite), COMP 4007 – Computer Applications Involving Analytics (no prerequisite), MGMT 4030 – Business Research (no prerequisite), MGMT 4084 – Digital Media Analysis (no prerequisite), STAT 4001 – Statistics I for Analytics (no prerequisite), and BUS 4022 – Programming Fundamentals for Analytics (no prerequisite). In Semester 2, the following courses are required: MARK 4018 – Data Mining & Modelling (prerequisite: STAT 4001), COMP 4008 – Advanced Computer Applications involving Analytics (prerequisite: COMP 4007), BUS 4023 – Business, Web and Social Media Metrics and Analysis (prerequisites: STAT 4001 and BUS 4022), BUS 4024 – Business Decision-Making Through Advanced Analytics (prerequisites: BUS 4022), MGMT 4083 – Business Metrics (no prerequisite), STAT 4003 – Statistics II for Analytics (prerequisite: STAT 4001), and BUS 4045 – Data Project Capstone Project (completion of Semester 1).

Graduates of this program will be able to extract, transform, and load data efficiently.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Analytics for Business Decision Making Program (Postgraduate) B412 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The graduate of this program is capable of performing various data-related tasks to support business decision-making. These tasks include extracting, transforming, and loading data; warehousing and mining data; developing classification and predictive models; determining the appropriate business intelligence tools for specific scenarios; communicating analytics results effectively; applying statistical techniques to Big Data; analyzing and interpreting digital information; and adhering to business ethics and corporate social responsibility principles.

Tuition fees for this program are as follows:
- Domestic students: $4,379.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2022)
- International students: $17,774.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2023)

This program is eligible for OSAP funding for domestic applicants who meet the eligibility criteria.

Admission requirements include a college advanced diploma or bachelor's degree, or relevant work experience with a resume and references required. International applicants may need to provide English language proficiency test results or undergo an assessment at George Brown College.

Please note that all information contained in the website is subject to change without notice. It should not be viewed as a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.

Context:
The text provides information on how to apply to George Brown College, specifically for domestic and international students. It also mentions various resources and contacts for admission requirements, financial aid, and program advising. Here is the extracted information:

- English proficiency requirements can be reviewed for more details.
- Some college or university credits may qualify for exemptions; see Transfer guide for more information.
- International Students should visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International Students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
- Information sessions are held on a regular basis, sign up for an upcoming session.
- Contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section for domestic admission inquiries.
- Contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page.
- For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.
- Make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor for advice on program options and which program might be best suited for you.
- Contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160 for inquiries regarding programs at the Centre for Business.
- For specific inquiries related to the Analytics for Business Decision-Making (Postgraduate) program, contact Robin Yap at ryp@georgebrown.ca.
